importantDates.descriptionOfWhyDateIsRelevant: The date of the article's publication indicates the most recent update on the ongoing situation in Gaza, highlighting the current state of the ceasefire and Israel's violations as of this time.

importantTimeframes.descriptionOfWhyTimeFrameIsRelevant: The period from the start of the ceasefire to the publication date marks the duration over which Israel's alleged violations have been documented, making it critical for understanding the timeline of the conflict.

keyTakeAways: Israel has killed 97 Palestinians in Gaza since the start of the ceasefire.
The Gaza Government Media Office reports that Israel has breached the truce agreement 80 times, including 21 violations on Sunday.
The violations include both the overall breach of ceasefire terms and specific instances of military action that contradict agreed-upon cease-fire provisions.

namedEntities.name: Israel
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A nation-state in the Middle East, involved in the ongoing conflict with Palestine.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Israel is central to the conflict, as the article reports on its actions in Gaza and allegations of ceasefire violations.

namedEntities.name: Gaza
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A Palestinian territory located in the eastern Mediterranean, currently under Israeli military control.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: Gaza is the location where the reported killings and ceasefire violations are taking place, making it the geographic and humanitarian focal point of the article.

namedEntities.name: Gaza Government Media Office
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An official body within the Gaza administration that reports on events and developments in the region.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The Gaza Government Media Office is cited as the source of information regarding Israel's breaches of the ceasefire agreement, providing a local perspective on the conflict.

namedEntities.name: Ceasefire
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: An agreement to halt military hostilities between opposing parties in a conflict.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: The ceasefire is the framework under which the alleged violations are being measured, and its breakdown is central to the article's narrative.

namedEntities.name: 21 violations on Sunday
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A specific number of breaches of the ceasefire reported on a single day.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This detail emphasizes the frequency and severity of Israel's breaches, suggesting a pattern of non-compliance with the agreed truce.

namedEntities.name: 97 Palestinians killed
namedEntities.whatIsThisEntity: A specific number of casualties reported in Gaza since the ceasefire began.
namedEntities.whyIsThisEntityRelevantToTheArticle: This statistic underscores the human cost of the conflict and serves as a key factual anchor for the article's claims about violence.

summaryOfNewsArticle: Since the start of a ceasefire, Israel has been accused of killing 97 Palestinians in Gaza and breaching the truce agreement 80 times, including 21 violations on Sunday, according to the Gaza Government Media Office. These reports highlight ongoing military actions that contradict the terms of the ceasefire, raising concerns about the effectiveness and sustainability of the peace agreement, and drawing attention to the humanitarian toll on civilians in Gaza.
title: Israel kills 97 Palestinians in Gaza since start of ceasefire
